Package com.appglu.android.cache

Contains the CacheManager interface and it's implementations.
A CacheManager is used for storing and caching files while using the StorageApi.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CacheManager A CacheManager is used for storing and caching files while using the StorageApi.
There are three CacheManager implementations available: memory (MemoryCacheManager), disk (FileSystemCacheManager) or both (MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager).
By default FileSystemCacheManager is used and it will cache the files on disk.
 

Class Summary
FileSystemCacheManager CacheManager implementation that will store the files on disk.
FileSystemCacheManager will first try the external storage, if it is available, if not it will use the internal storage.
It is possible to set the maximum number of bytes used on disk by calling FileSystemCacheManager.setMaxCacheSizeInBytes(long).
MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager CacheManager implementation that will store the files on memory and disk together, forming a two-level cache.
When retrieving the file it will first look on memory, if not found it will try the disk.
The maximum number of items on memory and the maximum number of bytes used on disk can be defined if the constructor MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager.MemoryAndFileSystemCacheManager(Context, int, long) is used.
MemoryCacheManager CacheManager implementation that will store the files on memory.
It is possible to set the maximum number of items on memory but calling MemoryCacheManager.setMaxCacheSizeInNumberOfItems(int).
 

Package com.appglu.android.cache Description

Contains the CacheManager interface and it's implementations.
A CacheManager is used for storing and caching files while using the StorageApi.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
CacheManager, StorageApi
